Product.name: Swiss Travel Pass
Product.description: Swiss Travel Pass is a must-have for any traveller to Switzerland. It allows unlimited access to all public trains, buses, boats and tram services all over the country. Swiss Travel Pass also offers numerous other benefits on the mountain excursions and free entrance to over 500 museums.

mainEntity.name: What is a Swiss Travel Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: A Swiss Travel Pass is a pass that allows you to access unlimited travel on a train, bus, boat, and tram across Switzerland's public transport and provides up to 50% discounts on excursions.

mainEntity.name: Where can I use my Swiss Travel Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can use your Swiss Travel Pass in the whole Swiss Travel System: in all trains, Post buses, ships, buses and even trams.

mainEntity.name: How do I book the Swiss Travel Pass online?

acceptedAnswer.text:
• Book your pass online on www.swisstours.com by clicking on the Swiss Travel Pass tab on the home page.
  • From the list of passes, select the Swiss Travel Pass that suits your travel requirements in terms of the number of days, 1st or 2nd class and consecutive or Flexi days' pass.
  • If you need help selecting the most appropriate pass, contact SWISStours specialists at contact@swisstours.com
  • After selection of the pass and submission of your details (name, passport number, date of travel, and other mandatory information) you will be directed to the payment page to the make payment.
  • Once the payment is complete, you will immediately receive an e-Swiss Travel Pass voucher in your email as an attachment.

mainEntity.name: How can I validate Swiss Travel Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text:
• Effective 1st September 2015, the Swiss Travel Pass is a pre validated & closed dated pass.
  • The traveller will need to provide their first day of use of the pass while making the booking. This date will be printed on the e-pass.
  • Travellers must carry a valid passport in order to travel with Swiss Rail Pass.

mainEntity.name: What is an adult Swiss Travel Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: A person aged above 26 years has to purchase an adult Swiss Travel Pass.

mainEntity.name: What is an youth Swiss Travel Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: A person aged between 16-25 years can purchase a youth Swiss Travel Pass.

mainEntity.name: What is a Swiss Family Card?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Swiss travel system offers the Swiss family card. This card provides free travel for children under 16 years when travelling with atleast one parent.

mainEntity.name: What is the difference between Consecutive Day Pass and Flexi Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text:
• A consecutive-day pass provides unlimited rail travel on all days for the chosen duration of the pass. This pass is preferred by those who wish to travel every day during their stay in Switzerland.
  • A flexi pass is valid for a specific number of days which can be used consecutively or non-consecutively within a longer period. This pass is preferred by those who wish to travel only on certain days during their stay in Switzerland.

mainEntity.name: Which mountains come at a discount with Swiss Travel Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The below are top mountain in Switzerland that come at discount with Swiss Travel Pass:
  • Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe
  • Matterhorn Glacier Paradise
  • Mount Titlis
  • Mount Pilatus
  • Grindelwald First
  • Harder Kulm
  • Glacier 3000

Product.name: Harder Kulm
Product.description: Harder Kulm is an ideal destination for foodies, fans of great views, hikers and nature lovers. At 1322 m above sea level, the Harder Kulm is Interlaken's home mountain and promises astounding views.

mainEntity.name: How do I reach Harder Kulm from Interlaken station?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you’re at Interlaken OST station, you walk for about 8 minutes to the “Harder Railway valley station”. From there, take the funicular to the top.

mainEntity.name: How much discount do you get with the Swiss Travel Pass on Harder Kulm?

acceptedAnswer.text: A Swiss Pass holder can purchase tickets to Harder Kulm at nearly half the rate. Children under 16 years whose parents hold the pass travel absolutely free. The full fare rate is CHF 34 pp, and the price with the Swiss Pass is CHF 17 pp.

mainEntity.name: How much time does it take to reach Harder Kulm from Interlaken?

acceptedAnswer.text: From Interlaken OST – Harder valley station – Approx 8 mins walk. Harder Valley station – Harder Kulm – 10 Mins on the funicular. So, in total, 18 – 20 mins.

mainEntity.name: Are there folklore performances happening on Harder Kulm?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, during the summer months, typical Swiss folklore performances take place on Harder Kulm. Let your gaze wander to the beautiful surroundings while you listen to live Swiss folklores.

mainEntity.name: What view do you get from the top of Harder Kulm?

acceptedAnswer.text: At 1322 m above sea level, you can view the world-famous trio of the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfraujoch. From the TWO LAKES BRIDGE you get the best view of Interlaken, including the 2 lakes - Thun to the right and Brienz to the left.

mainEntity.name: What are the main attractions at Harder Kulm?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Two-Lakes-Bridge, which is a viewing platform with a glass floor, which offers the best view of Interlaken, including the two lakes - Thun and Brienz; And a restaurant that looks a whole lot like a castle. During the summer months, experience a Swiss folklore performance.

mainEntity.name: Is it possible to go to Harder Kulm late evening?

acceptedAnswer.text: Between July and October, Harder Kulm is open till 21.00 - 21.30 hours. Of course, you would have to take the funicular at least an hour or so before the closing hours, so you have enough time on top. Please make sure you check the last ascent and descent timings of the funicular before you plan your trip. During the remaining months, the last ascent and descent are only around 16:40 hours.

mainEntity.name: Can Harder Kulm be combined with other tours?

acceptedAnswer.text: Since it takes less than half the day to complete a Harder Kulm excursion, you can combine it with a Jet Boat tour, or a city tour. You could do this on the day you arrive into Interlaken. You could even combine this with Grindelwald First provided you travel when Harder Kulm is open late evening (and if you’re interested in doing another mountain excursion the same day)

Product.name: Mount Titlis
Product.description: Mount Titlis–one of most visited experiential mountains in Switzerland–offers a plethora of exciting activities and adventures for all ages, and of course, amazing sights of the snow-capped mountain peaks, deep crevasses, and immaculate white, expansive snowfields..

mainEntity.name: How do you reach Mount Titlis from Lucerne?

acceptedAnswer.text: Take the train from Lucerne to Engelberg station. From there, either walk (approx. 10 mins) or take the shuttle bus to the Valley Station. The cable car takes you from the base station to Stand station via Trubsee. From Stand, you change onto the Titlis Rotair cable car to reach the summit.

mainEntity.name: How long is the journey from Lucerne to Mount Titlis?

acceptedAnswer.text: Approximately 1 hour 20 mins. The train journey from Lucerne–Engelberg around 40 mins. Engelberg station to Titlis Valley station–10 Mins. The total cable car journey from Valley Station to the summit via Stand–20 mins approx.

mainEntity.name: How long is the journey from the Valley Station to the summit of Mount Titlis?

acceptedAnswer.text: Total cable car journey from Valley Station to the summit via Stand–20 mins.Titlis–Stand (mid-station) by cable car is a 15 mins journey.Stand Station–a summit on the Titlis Rotair is around 5–8 mins.This does not include any waiting time in between for the cable car..

mainEntity.name: Do kids travel free to Mt Titlis?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Kids below 16 years of age,holding a valid Swiss Family Card,do not pay for their tickets to Mt Titlis.Children between 6–16 years holding a Eurail pass pay CHF 42.Kids between 6–16 years who do not have a Swiss Family Card or a Eurail Pass pay CHF 48.
Make sure you have the Swiss Family card or the Eurail pass with you while purchasing these tickets at a discounted rate.

mainEntity.name: What is the cost of Titlis Cliff Walk and the Titlis Chair Lift?

acceptedAnswer.text: Titlis Cliff Walk-The highest suspension bridge in Europe,and the Chair lift are included in the cost of Titlis ticket.

mainEntity.name: What the various things to do on Mt Titlis?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Glacier Cave, Glacier Park, Titlis Cliff Walk, Ice Flyer Chair Lift are some of the things you can do upon Mt Titlis.
Titlis ROTAIR (World's first revolving cable car) is something that you experience on your way up to the Mountain.

mainEntity.name: What is the discount you get on Titlis tickets with the Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Swiss Pass holder rate for Titlis is CHF 60. The full fare rate is CHF 96. Around 62% reduction with the Swiss Pass.

mainEntity.name: What is Titlis ROTAIR?

acceptedAnswer.text: Mt.Titlis ROTAIR is the world’s first revolving cable car that revolves 360-degrees during the five-minute journey.The cable car revolves as it ascends from the middle station at Stand up till the summit station at 3020 meters above sea level.

mainEntity.name: Should one visit Mt Titlis?

acceptedAnswer.text: For anyone who is visiting Switzerland for the first time, Mt Titlis is one of the mountains you should have in your list of excursions. Economically priced, Titlis offers many activities on the mountain, good views, and lets you to experience the highest suspension bridge and the world's first revolving gondola during your visit.

mainEntity.name: How many hours would you spend on completing Titlis as an excursion?

acceptedAnswer.text: You would spend about 5–6 hours including your lunchtime on Mt Titlis, plus one hour travel time from the base station to the summit and back.

Product.name: Mount Pilatus
Product.description: Mount Pilatus is one of the most scenic spots in Switzerland located at 2073 metres above sea level and views over 73 Alpine peaks on a clear day. There are a few legends surrounding Mount Pilatus. One of them says that the mountain is named after the famous ruler Pontius Pilate who is believed to be buried there. Another says that in the Middle Ages, dragons with healing powers lived among the cliffs.

mainEntity.name: What is the discount on Mount Pilatus with the Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: With the Swiss Travel Pass, you get a 50% discounted rate on Mt Pilatus tickets. The full fare rate is CHF 72, and the Swiss Passholder fare is CHF 36.

mainEntity.name: Where can I purchase the tickets for Mount Pilatus?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can pre-book your tickets to Mt Pilatus online on swisstours.com.

mainEntity.name: How do I reach the valley stations of Mount Pilatus?

acceptedAnswer.text:
You can reach Mount Pilatus from its valley stations - Alpnachstad or Kriens.
KRIENS: From Lucerne main station, take a bus to Kriens (Zentrum Pilatus), and walk for about 5 mins to Kriens valley station.
ALPNACHSTAD: From Lucerne Main Station, continue your train journey to Alpnachstad station OR take the boat from the pier across Lucerne railway station to Alpnachstad.

mainEntity.name: How do I reach Mount Pilatus?

acceptedAnswer.text: From Lucerne station, make your way to Alpnachstad either by train or boat and then take the steepest cogwheel railway to reach the summit of Mt Pilatus. Alternatively, you can start from Kriens. Take a short bus ride from Lucerne Station to Kriens (Zentrum Pilatus), take the gondola to Frakmuntegg and then switch to the cable car to reach the summit.

mainEntity.name: What is the Golden Round Trip to Mt Pilatus?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Your excursion to Mt Pilatus includes a boat ride, ascend by cogwheel and descend by cablecar, thus creating a golden round trip. Lucerne Station-Alpnachstad by boat; Alpnachstad – the summit of Mt Pilatus by the steep cogwheel railway; Summit-Fräkmüntegg on the “Dragon Ride” aerial cableway; Fräkmüntegg-Kriens by the panorama Gondolas.
The round trip can be done in the opposite direction as well. These operate only on certain months, and hence it is advisable to check before taking this trip.

mainEntity.name: What activities can you find at Mt Pilatus?

acceptedAnswer.text: Toboggan Run, Pilu Land, Dragon World, Dragon Glider, Tandem Paragliding are some of the things to you can do on Mt Pilatus.

mainEntity.name: What is the Silver Round Trip to Mt Pilatus?

acceptedAnswer.text: Your excursion to Mt Pilatus includes an ascend by cogwheel and descend by cablecar and gondola, which make the Silver Round trip to Mt Pilatus. Route(Can be done in the opp direction): Lucerne Station- Alpnachstad by train; Alpnachstad–the summit of Mt Pilatus by the steep cogwheel; Summit-Fräkmüntegg on the “Dragon Ride” aerial cableway; Fräkmüntegg-Kriens by the panorama Gondolas.These operate only on certain months; hence it is advisable to check before taking this trip.

mainEntity.name: Does the Swiss Pass include an excursion to Mt Pilatus?

acceptedAnswer.text: Mt Pilatus is not free with the Swiss Pass but is available at a discounted price of CHF 36 per adult with Swiss Pass. Children below 16 years, holding a Swiss Family Card travel free. If you take the 'Golden Round Trip' the boat ride, which is a part of the route is also included in the Swiss Pass.

mainEntity.name: How long does it take to reach Mt Pilatus from Lucerne?

acceptedAnswer.text: It takes around 1 Hour 10 mins from Lucerne main station to Pilatus Kulm.This could either be the Lucerne–Kriens-Fräkmüntegg-Pilatus Kulm route, OR the Lucerne main station-Alpnachstad-Pilatus Kulm route.

mainEntity.name: From which other cities can I cover Mt Pilatus if I do not stay in Lucerne?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you stay in Zurich, it will take you around 2 hours to reach Mt Pilatus.The train journey between Zurich and Lucerne is 50 mins.Remaining 1 hour for your trip to Mt Pilatus. You can consider Interlaken as well,however,it takes 1 hour 50 mins from Interlaken-Lucerne by train and then some additional travel time to go up to the mountain-So go in for this option only if you are ready to travel that extra bit by train.

Product.name: Grindelwald First
Product.description: Mount Pilatus is one of the most scenic spots in Switzerland located at 2073 metres above sea level and views over 73 Alpine peaks on a clear day. There are a few legends surrounding Mount Pilatus. One of them says that the mountain is named after the famous ruler Pontius Pilate who is believed to be buried there. Another says that in the Middle Ages, dragons with healing powers lived among the cliffs.

mainEntity.name: How do I reach from Grindelwald Station to Grindelwald First?

acceptedAnswer.text: From Grindelwald station, you walk for about 8 – 10 mins to the First Railway valley station. Gondolas will transport you from the valley station to Grindelwald Fist in three sections: Grindelwald - Bort - Schreckfeld – Peak.

mainEntity.name: How much discount do you get with the Swiss Travel Pass on Grindelwald First tickets?

acceptedAnswer.text: The full fare rate for Grindelwald First with one activity is CHF 74 per adult. The Swiss Passholder rate is CHF 50 per adult. The cost changes depending on the number of activities you take.

mainEntity.name: What is Grindelwald First best known for?

acceptedAnswer.text: Grindelwald First is known as the “Top of Adventure”, as it offers several activities which give you an adrenaline rush. You have the First Flyer - 800-metre-long zip-line; First Glider - Glide down like an Eagle through an 800-metre-long journey at 83 kms/hr; Mountain Cart; Trottibike scooter; First Cliff Walk By Tissot; Bort Alpine Playground for kids.

mainEntity.name: How long does it take to reach from Grindelwald First valley station to Grindelwald First?

acceptedAnswer.text: Travel time from Grindelwald valley station to Grindelwald First: approximately 25 minutes.

mainEntity.name: What view do you get from the top of Harder Kulm?

acceptedAnswer.text: At 1322 m above sea level, you can view the world-famous trio of the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfraujoch. From the TWO LAKES BRIDGE you get the best view of Interlaken, including the 2 lakes - Thun to the right and Brienz to the left.

mainEntity.name: Is the Grindelwald First Cliff Walk free?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Grindelwald First Cliff Walk is included in the cost of the Grindelwald Tickets.

mainEntity.name: What makes the descent from Grindelwald First to the valley station different from other mountains?

acceptedAnswer.text: Instead of coming down by the regular cable car, you can come down by doing 3 different activities. From the peak to Schreckfeld: First Glider or First Flyer; Schreckfeld to Bort: Mountain Cart; Bort to Grindelwald: Trottibike scooter. This way, you experience a completely different side of things on the way down from Grindelwald First to Grindelwald Valley station.

mainEntity.name: Is there any minimum height and weight criteria for the activities on Grindelwald First?

acceptedAnswer.text:
First Flier : minimum weight 35 kgs
First Glider : min age 10 yrs / min height 130 cms / max weight 125 kgs
Mountain Cart : min height 135 cms
Trotti Bike: min height 125 cms

mainEntity.name: Is there any kid’s area at Grindelwald First?

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a playground for children called BORT ALPINE PLAYGROUND, where you can find rocks shaped like Squirrels and Marmots. It also has a rope park. Grindelwald First also has a Marmot Trail which is a 2 hour trail from First to Schilt, where you can learn about Marmot life, pose at the photo wall and even have the chance to spot marmots.

mainEntity.name: Are the activities on the Grindelwald First included in the entrance ticket price?

acceptedAnswer.text: The activities are not included in the Grindelwald First entrance tickets. You would have to choose the option of entrance plus 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 activities, as the prices vary. These could be either Full fare rates, or Swiss Pass holder rates. These can be booking online on https://www.swisstours.com/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first

mainEntity.name: Can you do an excursion to Jungfraujoch and Grindelwald First on the same day?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, by the time you finish Grindelwald its already lunchtime. Jungfraujoch is a full day excursion – Hence this cannot be combined.

Product.name: Glacier 3000
Product.description: Glacier 3000 promises thrill! Over 3000 metres above sea level, Glacier 3000 offers stunning views and a wide range of activities for families and all ages

mainEntity.name: How do you reach Glacier 3000?

acceptedAnswer.text: From Gstaad train station, take a bus which takes you to Col Du Pillon from where you will hop on to the cable car to reach the peak of Glacier 3000.

mainEntity.name: Is Glacier 3000 covered in the Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: Glacier 3000 is covered under the Swiss Pass, but the excursion ticket isn’t free. It is available at a price of CHF 40 per person which is the Swiss Pass holder rate.

mainEntity.name: What is the discount you get with the Swiss Pass on Glacier 3000?

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a 50% discounted rate with the Swiss Pass for Glacier 3000 tickets. The full fare price is CHF 80 per person, and the Swiss Pass holder fare is CHF 40 per person.

mainEntity.name: What are the activities you can do at Glacier 3000?

acceptedAnswer.text: Peak walk by Tissot, Alpine coaster (In summer), Snow Bus, Dogsled rides, sliding at the Fun Park are some of the activities available on Glacier 3000.

mainEntity.name: Alpine Coaster and Dogsled rides are included in the ticket cost of Glacier 3000?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, there’s an additional supplement that needs to be paid for both activities. Dog Sled rides have to be pre booked. Alpine coaster can be paid at the counter directly.

mainEntity.name: What is the Tissot Peak Walk and why is it so famous at Glacier 3000?

acceptedAnswer.text: Tissot Peak Walk is a suspension bridge which connects 2 peaks. It is 107-metre-long and 80 cm wide bridge which offers stunning views of the alpine landscape around you. It is included in the Glacier 3000 entrance ticket and open year-round.

mainEntity.name: How do you reach the valley station of Glacier 3000?

acceptedAnswer.text: Take the train to Gstaad station. Once you exit from Gstaad station, you will see yellow busses parked outside the station’s bus terminal. Take the one which reads “Les Diablerets” on the indicator, and get off at Col-du-Pillon, which is the base station to Glacier 3000.

mainEntity.name: How far is the valley station of Glacier 3000 located from Gstaad station?

acceptedAnswer.text: From Gstaad station, the post bus to Col-du-Pillon valley station of Glacier 3000, takes around 33 minutes.

mainEntity.name: Are kids allowed on the Alpine coaster on Glacier 3000?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, children under 9 years can ride tandem with another person of over 9 years of age. Adults would have to be 130cm in height to sit on the Alpine coaster.

mainEntity.name: Do kids get a special rate on Glacier 3000 with Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, children between 9 – 15 years with a family card do not have to pay any entrance fees. Children between the age of 9 – 15 who do not hold a Swiss Pass, pay CHF 40 per child. Children below 8 years are free irrespective.

Product.name: Diavolezza
Product.description: Diavolezza also known as the “She-Mountain” is renowned for its spectacular views over the eternal ice. Legend has it that there was a she – devil who stayed in these mountains and enticed young suitors who never returned again after following her shadow

mainEntity.name: What activities can you do from St Moritz?

acceptedAnswer.text: From St Moritz, you could do an excursion to Diavolezza. This mountain is located at an altitude of 2,978m, and is renowned for its spectacular views over the eternal ice. This is simply a divine place to just lay back and absorb the fabulous views of Mother Nature. Try taking one of the scenic trains – Bernina Express or Glacier Express.

mainEntity.name: Is there any reduction on the Diavolezza ticket with Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: Unfortunately, there is no discounted rate with the Swiss Pass on Diavolezza. However, they are reasonably priced.  The cost per adult is CHF 39 per adult.

mainEntity.name: How does one reach the Diavolezza from St Moritz?

acceptedAnswer.text: Just a 20-minute train ride from St. Moritz to Bernina Diavolezza train station. From there the cable car station is just 100m away. The cable car runs every 20 mins and takes you to the summit in just 10 minutes.

mainEntity.name: What are the various things to do on Diavolezza in St Moritz?

acceptedAnswer.text: There are various activities you could try at Diavolezza like hiking, climbing trails, the Devil’s ride (slide down the 80m long sledging snow)try the Virtual Reality cinema at the Funpark, or the Jacuzzi on the sun terrace of the Berghaus Diavolezza mountain hotel.

mainEntity.name: What is the jacuzzi experience on Diavolezza?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Jacuzzi is situated on the sun terrace of the Berghaus Diavolezza mountain hotel and offers stunning alpine views of the snowy mountain peaks and the amazing glaciers of Bernina massif as well as the Piz Palü. Soak yourself in Europe’s highest altitude open-air hot tub with a glass of champagne and gaze at the amazing vistas that stretch out before you.

mainEntity.name: Are there any restaurants available at Diavolezza?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Diavoelezza has restaurants. Just next to the cable car is the Bellavista Panaroma Restaurant. This restaurant with a panoramic terrace serves authentic local Swiss food. This restaurant has a capacity to accommodate 300 persons.

mainEntity.name: What is the Devil’s ride at Diavolezza?

acceptedAnswer.text: This is Diavolezza’s latest attraction. You can experience the thrill of sliding down the 80m long sledging snow and then take the lift back up again. This activity is valid only during May as this is a skiing mountain and the season ends in May.

mainEntity.name: Can the excursion to Diavolezza be combined with anything else?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can combine the Diavolezza mountain excursion with panaromic trains like the Bernina Express and the Glacier Express trains.

mainEntity.name: Are there any hotels located on Diavolezza?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can spend the night at the Berghaus on Diavolezza where they offer Hotel class Double Rooms, multi-bed rooms and bunk style accommodations.

mainEntity.name: What is the cost of a ticket to Diavolezza, St Moritz?

acceptedAnswer.text: The cost for Diavolezza tickets are as follows: Adult – CHF 39, Child between 13-17 yrs – CHF 26, Child between 06-12 yrs - CHF 13 .Child below 06 yrs travells free. There is no reduction available with the Swiss Pass, but the rates are very economical.

Product.name: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise
Product.description: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise is a world of adventures where you luxuriate to savor breathtaking views of mountains in Switzerland, Italy, and France. Along with being the highest cable car station in Europe at 3883 meters, Matterhorn Glacier Paradise is also home to the highest mountain restaurant and the world’s highest glacier palace

mainEntity.name: How do I reach Matterhorn Glacier Paradise?

acceptedAnswer.text:
From Zermatt station, you can either walk (20-minute walk) or take an electric bus to reach the gondola valley station.
To reach Matterhorn Glacier Paradise you have 3 gondolas to change from the valley station:
1st Segment: Valley Station – Furi
2nd Segment: Furi to Trockener Steg
3rd Segment: Trockener Steg to Klein Matterhorn.

mainEntity.name: How much discount do you get with the Swiss Travel Pass on Matterhorn Glacier Paradise?

acceptedAnswer.text: With a Swiss Pass, you get a 50% discounted rate on the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise tickets. The full fare rate is CHF 104, and the Swiss Pass holder rate is CHF 52 per person. Rates for Matterhorn Glacier Paradise vary with season; therefore, it is advisable to check the prices before booking.

mainEntity.name: What are the various things one can do at Matterhorn Glacier Paradise?

acceptedAnswer.text: There are five things to do at Matterhorn Glacier Paradise: 360-degree viewing platform, Glacier Ice Palace, restaurant with panoramic windows, Peak Shop, and Cinema Lounge.

mainEntity.name: How long does it take to reach Matterhorn Glacier Paradise from Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: The entire journey from Zermatt rail station to Matterhorn Glacier Paradise takes around 40 - 50 minutes, including the gondola changes.

mainEntity.name: Does Matterhorn Glacier Paradise have different gondola ride options to choose from?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, only on the last segment, from Trockener Steg to Klein Matterhorn, you have an option to choose from various types of gondola rides: The regular gondola ride, the ‘Crystal ride’, which has a glass floor that becomes transparent in 3 minutes once the ride begins. You can even choose a VIP gondola, breakfast gondola, or a fondue gondola. Each of these has a different price.

mainEntity.name: What are the various excursions you can do from Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: Matterhorn is extremely popular, but you also have Sunnegga, Gornergrat and Rothorn.

mainEntity.name: Why is Matterhorn Glacier Paradise famous?

acceptedAnswer.text: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise has highest cable car station in Europe at 3883 meters; It is home to the highest mountain restaurant (Matterhorn Glacier Paradise restaurant), It has the world’s highest glacier ice palace and also has the highest viewing platform in the Swiss Alps (360-degree panorama-viewing platform).

mainEntity.name: Is Matterhorn the mountain on Toblerone chocolate?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the Toblerone chocolate is designed after the shape of the Matterhorn, which is another reason why people love visiting Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. It is also the most photographed mountain in the world.

mainEntity.name: What is the view like on the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise?

acceptedAnswer.text: The awe-inspiring views of snow-clad mountains and glaciers are captivating from the 360-degree panorama-viewing platform at Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. This platform makes it possible to glance 38 four thousand meters tall mountains and 14 glaciers spread across France, Italy, and Switzerland. You will enjoy the closest views of Matterhorn, spot Mont Blanc – Europe’s highest mountain – and then find the majestic Jungfrau, towering in its all might at a distant.

mainEntity.name: Do kids travel free on Matterhorn Glacier Paradise?

acceptedAnswer.text: Children between 0-15 years with a Family Card travel free. Children between 0 – 8 Years who do not have a Family card also travel free on Matterhorn Glacier Paradise.

Product.name: Stanserhorn
Product.description: At 1900-meter above sea level, Stanserhorn is an ideal spot to appreciate and experience the pristine beauty of Switzerland. Relax at the sunny rooftop to gaze distant mountains, as far as Mount Titlis and Alsace, or gleam at ten turquoise-blue lakes, and on a clear day, even peak at the neighbouring country’s nature – the Black Forest in Germany.

mainEntity.name: What makes Stanserhorn different from other mountain excursions?

acceptedAnswer.text: The journey up to the mountain – By the CabriO: Which is the world’s first open double-decker cable car. A one-of-its-kind cable car is a combination of a mighty, luxurious bus with a convertible-car-like open roof, allowing you to bask 360-degree panoramic views, unlike other cable cars, which have a closed roof.

mainEntity.name: Where is Stanserhorn located?

acceptedAnswer.text: Stanserhorn is located in Stans, Lucerne.

mainEntity.name: What is the discount offered on Stanserhorn with Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: Stanserhorn is covered under the Swiss pass and is completely free.

mainEntity.name: How do you reach Stanserhorn?

acceptedAnswer.text: To reach Stanserhorn, make your way to Stans which is 20 mins away by train from Lucerne. Walk for about 5 minutes to the valley station that takes you to the mid-station “Kalti” in a funicular. From Kalti, hop aboard CabriO – the open rooftop cable car. This journey would be for 6 – 7 minutes approx, after which you arrive at the top.

mainEntity.name: How long does the CabriO journey on the way to Stanserhorn take?

acceptedAnswer.text: It takes 6 and a half minutes on the CabriO, to get to the top of Stanserhorn.

mainEntity.name: Do you have hiking options at Stanserhorn?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Stanserhorn does have hiking options – For beginners, there’s a 30-minute’s walk around the mountain, and for regular hikers, you can walk from Stans up to the peak of Stanserhorn – which is near 4 hours hike.

mainEntity.name: What is the cost of Stanserhorn?

acceptedAnswer.text: The cost of Stanserhorn is CHF 74 per adult and child between 06-16 yrs is CHF 37 per child.

mainEntity.name: How much time does it take to reach Stanserhorn from Lucerne?

acceptedAnswer.text: It takes about 44 mins to an hour to reach Stanserhorn from Lucerne via Stans and Kalti.

mainEntity.name: Are there any restaurants at Stanserhorn?

acceptedAnswer.text: Stanserhorn does have a summit restaurant named “Rondorama”.

Product.name: Jetboat
Product.description: Jetboat ride in Interlaken is an adventure that is sure to take your breath away. Get up-close and personal with the exhilarating views of the Jungfrau region from Lake Brienz as the Jetboat takes you on a ride of a lifetime. This thrilling adventure is for all ages, be it children or senior citizens and is a must while in the Bernese Oberland. The Jetboat is sure to give the adrenaline rush that you deserve on a perfect Swiss holiday.

mainEntity.name: What is the duration of Jetboat ride in Interlaken?

acceptedAnswer.text: The duration for Jetboat is a 50-minute boat ride during summer & 35-minute ride during winter.

mainEntity.name: Is there any discount with the Swiss Travel Pass on Jetboat tickets?

acceptedAnswer.text: Unfortunately, there is no Swiss Pass holder fare on the Jetboat tickets. Jetboat only has a full fare rate.

mainEntity.name: Are reservations compulsory for the Jetboat ride?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, reservations have to be made at least 2 days prior.

mainEntity.name: What is the procedure for making a reservation on Jetboat?

acceptedAnswer.text: Once you purchase Jetboat tickets, your voucher contains an email address and a phone number, using which you can pre book seats on the jet boat. You have to give a fixed date and time (from the time slots provided) at the time of making a reservation. Once a reservation is made, no changes possible. You will receive another confirmation email after this which will have to be presented on the day of the tour.

mainEntity.name: What does a Jetboat booking include?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Your Jetboat ticket includes:
  • Pick up & drop to & from the Interlaken region (from centrally located hotels)
  • Protective gear complete with a waterproof jacket, pants, headgear and gloves
  • 50-minute boat ride during summer & 35 minutes during winter
  • Free download of photos
  • The winter experience comes with the authentic swiss fondue which you are treated to after the boat ride
  • Photos can be downloaded free of cost and shared with your loved ones after this memorable trip

mainEntity.name: Which places does the Jetboat take you during the 50 mins (Or 35 minute ride)?

acceptedAnswer.text: The journey starts from Bonigen to the majestic and spectacular Giessbach waterfalls. The captain explains the history and culture of the region while you enjoy the stunning views onboard. The boat takes speed and thrills you with 360-degree spins & drifts that surely leave you wanting for more as the ride continues to the town of Iseltwald. The splendid views of the Jungfrau region add magic to this unforgettable and truly memorable ride!

mainEntity.name: What are the time slots available for the Jetboat ride?

acceptedAnswer.text: The usual peak season timings for Jetboat are from 10 am to 4 Pm, every 2 hours (10 AM | 12 PM | 2 PM | 4 PM). The time slots during winter are 11am, 1pm and 3pm. It is suggested that you check the updated timings with us before confirming.

mainEntity.name: What's the minimum age criteria for Jetboat ride?

acceptedAnswer.text: In order to ride on the Jetboat, a child must be minimum 5 years of age.

mainEntity.name: How many persons can the Jetboat accommodate at a time?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Jetboat has a seating capacity of 11 passengers at a time.

mainEntity.name: Are there any special fares or discounted for the Jetboat rides?

acceptedAnswer.text: Please check with us for rates related to family groups (2 adults and 2 kids) or a standard group (9 passengers).

Product.name: Swiss Museum of Transport
Product.description: Enter the most visited museum in all of Switzerland and be amazed with its offerings! Follow the history of the world of transport, be it road, rail, water, air or even space. The unique collection of more than 3,000 objects related with transport and mobility is presented in an astounding more than 20,000 m2 of exhibition space.

mainEntity.name: Is the Swiss Transport Museum in Lucerne worth going to?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Swiss Transport Museum is Switzerland’s most visited and most popular museum. Unlike other museums, this one is an interactive museum which brings out the history of transportation – Rail, Water, Air and even Space. The unique collection of more than 3,000 objects related to transport and mobility is presented in a great more than 20,000 m2 of exhibition space.

mainEntity.name: Is the Swiss Transport Museum recommended for children?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the Swiss Transport Museum is a place of discovery and activity and will be a real treat for young inquisitive minds. Other than showcasing models and other artefacts related to transport this attraction offers much more.

mainEntity.name: Do kids get a reduction on the Swiss Transport Museum tickets?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Yes. Kids get a reduction in the prices of Swiss Transport Museum tickets. Children holding a Swiss Family Card get an additional discount.
Child 06 - 15 yrs (With Family Card) - CHF 16.00
Child under 06 yrs (With Family Card) - CHF 11.00
Child 06 - 15 yrs - CHF 22.00
Child under 06 yrs - CHF 11.00

mainEntity.name: What is the discount on the Swiss Transport Museum with the Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: Swiss Travel Pass holders get a discounted rate of CHF 40 on the Swiss Transport Museum ticket. The full fare rate is CHF 56.

mainEntity.name: How does one reach the Swiss Transport Museum?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The Swiss Transport Museum can be reached by:
Bus – 10 Mins, Station: Verkehrshaus
Boat – 10 Mins, Station: Verkehrshaus Lido
Train – 8 Mins, Station: Luzern Verkehrshaus

mainEntity.name: What are the dates of operation at the Swiss Transport Museum?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Swiss Transport Museum is open throughout the year, from 10 am to 5 pm.

mainEntity.name: What are the various things to do at the Swiss Transport Museum?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Swiss Transport Museum DAYPASS gives you access to: Media World, Cinema: Switzerland’s largest cinema screen, Planetarium: 360-degree dome, Swiss Chocolate Adventure.

mainEntity.name: What is the Swiss Chocolate Adventure in the Swiss Transport Museum?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Swiss Chocolate Adventure in the Swiss Transport Museum is a 20 minutes multimedia ride, which explains the discovery, manufacture and transport of chocolate. This attraction is one of the most popular ones in the museum. Here you get the opportunity to explore all your senses: see, hear, smell, taste and feel the chocolate. At the end of the tour, you receive mini chocolate!

mainEntity.name: Does the Swiss Transport Museum have Wifi facility?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, free wireless internet access is available within the premises of the museum.

mainEntity.name: Is the Swiss Transport Museum a half-day tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, the Swiss Transport Museum is a full-day tour, if you’re looking at covering all sections i.e Media World, Cinema, Planetarium, Swiss Chocolate Adventure. You will take about 5 - 6 hours here.

mainEntity.name: What is the Media World at the Swiss Transport Museum?

acceptedAnswer.text: At the Swiss Transport Museum, you can discover the multifaceted world of new and traditional media. Media World offers a variety of ways of experimenting with a range of media. It offers virtual reality goggles, a TV studio, a green screen facility and a 360° photo booth for taking all-round selfies.

Product.name: Sunnegga
Product.description: A must-do while in Zermatt, is the excursion to the charming Sunnegga Paradise. Offering stunning views of the Matterhorn, the Sunnega Paradise is an ideal family getaway all through the year. It offers something for all ages and all fitness levels. Picnics or hiking in the summer or skiing in the winter, Sunnega is where this is all possible.

mainEntity.name: What are the various mountain excursions one can do from Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: From Zermatt, the following mountain excursions are popular: Matterhorn, Sunnegga, Gornergrat.

mainEntity.name: What is the price of Sunnegga with the Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: The price of Sunnegga for a Swiss Pass holder is CHF 11 (nearly 50% discount). The full fare of Sunnegga CHF 21 without a Swiss Pass.

mainEntity.name: Why should one visit Sunnegga?

acceptedAnswer.text: Sunnegga offers stunning views of the Matterhorn, and is the starting point for most hikes. It also offers first skiing experiences for beginners/youngsters.

mainEntity.name: What activities can one do at Sunnegga?

acceptedAnswer.text: Wolli Adventure Park; Kickbike; Hiking; Marmots Trails are a few activities one can experience at Sunnegga.

mainEntity.name: Are there any restaurants at Sunnegga?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Sunnegga has a restaurant named “Buffett Bar Sunnega”, which offers amazing views of the Matterhorn.

mainEntity.name: How does one reach Sunnegga?

acceptedAnswer.text: Getting to the Sunnegga paradise is convenient. The Sunnegga-Rothorn valley station is a comfortable 10-minute walk away from Zermatt train station. Just hop on to the funicular that takes you to the top in under 5 minutes.

mainEntity.name: Is Kickbiking at Sunnegga suitable for children? What is the procedure to take this activity?

acceptedAnswer.text: Kickbiking is suitable for both young and old. This activity is recommended for kids over 9 years of age. Bikes can be rented from the Sunnega-Rothorn valley station once you have the helmets on its time to descend 821 metres of pure fun. The brakes in your bike help you control the speed.

mainEntity.name: Is the Wolli Adventure Park at Sunnegga fun?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Wolli Adventure Park at Sunnegga is a perfect spot in the most scenic setting, this park offers summer and winter fun for all ages. Come summer, you can have a refreshing dip in the lake, cross the lake on a secured raft and spend the day at its various picnic and barbeque spots. In winter, this is the ideal place for beginners of all ages to try their hand at skiing.

mainEntity.name: What is the Marmots Trail at Sunnegga?

acceptedAnswer.text: The marmot watching station is very famous in the summer to watch the cute and charming marmot. There are also theme trails that help us understand more about our furry friends who live in deep burrows on the Swiss Alps.

Product.name: Swissminiatur
Product.description: Swiss Miniatur is located in Melide, just a 7 minute train ride from Lugano. The park boasts of more than 120 models of all the Swiss attractions. The Park also has various kinds of rides for children. You can also find your favourite Indian cuisine at the restaurant.

mainEntity.name: How Do You Reach Swiss Miniatur?

acceptedAnswer.text: In order to reach Swiss Miniatur, take a train to Melide station (Melide is 7 mins away by train from Lugano station). From there, you walk for a few minutes to the Park (200 Meters). The train ride is included in the Swiss Pass.

mainEntity.name: What are the various ways to reach Swiss Miniatur?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Swiss Miniatur can be reached in 3 ways:
BY CAR: A2 motorway (Chiasso – Italy) – take the Melide exit. A2 motorway (Chiasso – St Gotthard) – take the Bissone/Campione d’Italia exit.
BY TRAIN: From Lugano, its a 7-minute train ride to Melide station, then a few mins walk to the Swiss Miniatur park
BY BOAT: From Lugano: a 35-minute boat ride will take you to Melide, around 400 metres from Swiss Miniatur.

mainEntity.name: What can you see at Swiss Miniatur in Lugano?

acceptedAnswer.text: Swiss Miniatur is an open air museum, where you find the whole of Switzerland reproduced in a miniature form with models of famous buildings, castles and various modes of transport like trains, cable cars, funiculars, all built at a scale of 1:25. It even has a small airport with various Aeroplanes within it, and a rail tracks with some regular and scenic trains moving about. The park also has a variety of trees and flower species, a playground for kids and a self-service restaurant.

mainEntity.name: How many models can you see at Swiss Miniatur?

acceptedAnswer.text: There are around 128 models in Swiss Miniatur, in the 1:25 scale traditionally made by artisans.

mainEntity.name: Does Swiss Miniatur have a restautant within the park?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Swiss Miniatur has a “Grotto” within the park, where you can have a meal, or just enjoy some Ice cream and relax.

mainEntity.name: How much does the ticket to Swiss Miniatur cost?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Tickets to Swiss Miniatur are economically priced. The rates are as given below:
Adult Entrance Ticket - CHF 19.00 per adult
Child 06-16 yrs Entrance Ticket - CHF 12.00 per child
Child 03-05 yrs Entrance only – FREE!

mainEntity.name: What are the Swiss Miniatur park timings?

acceptedAnswer.text: Swiss Miniatur is every day from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. (last entry 5:30 p.m.).

mainEntity.name: Does Swiss Miniatur have Wheelchair access?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Swiss Miniatur has wheelchair accessible areas.

mainEntity.name: How much time can one spend at Swiss Miniatur? Can this be combined with anything else?

acceptedAnswer.text: Swiss Miniatur is a half day tour. You would spend approximately 3 hours around the park. If you have before or after this tour, take the train to Fox Town in Mendrisio. Fox Town is the large factory outlet where you can shop for branded goods. You can also visit lake Lugano, or the “Parco Ciani” located by the lake to get a panoramic view of of the city, the lakes, Monte Bré and Monte San Salvatore.

mainEntity.name: Is Swiss Miniatur a good sightseeing option for children?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Swiss Miniatur is surely a good sightseeing option for adults and kids alike. Swiss Miniatur has a play area for kids, where they can spend their leisure time while you enjoy your meal at the restaurant inside. The souvenir shops also have stuffed toys, and a range of traditional biscuits, lollipops and other confectionaries available. Kids can go gallivanting over the 14,000 square meter park and take pictures with the tiny buildings, ships, planes and mountains. To add to all this, kids below 5 years have free entrance to the park.

Product.name: Rochers De Naye
Product.description: If you’re a nature lover, this destination is a must-do. At an altitude of 2,042 m, Rochers-de-Naye is a unique place that can be reached via a charming cog railway from Montreux. The journey to the summit takes around 55 minutes, and once you’re there, you have a host of activities accessible to you including hiking or walks for the whole family, visiting the Marmot Paradise wildlife park or the La Rambertia alpine garden and even skiing in the winter.

mainEntity.name: Where can you do Rochers De Naye from?

acceptedAnswer.text: Rochers De Naye is to be done from Montreux, Switzerland.

mainEntity.name: What exactly is Rochers De Naye?

acceptedAnswer.text: Rochers De Naye is a mountain excursion from Montreux. From here you can enjoy views of Lake Geneva, Vaud, Valais, Bern the Swiss and French Alps. A must do for nature lovers.

mainEntity.name: What activities can one do from Montreux?

acceptedAnswer.text: From Montreux, one can visit the Chillon Castle, do an excursion to Rochers De Naye, do an excursion Glacier 3000.

mainEntity.name: How do you reach Rochers De Naye?

acceptedAnswer.text: Reaching Rochers De Naye is quite simple. From Montreux, take the cog railway all the way to the summit.

mainEntity.name: What activities can you do on Rochers De Naye?

acceptedAnswer.text: The various activities available at Rochers De Naye is the Alpine garden “La Rambertia“, Marmot Paradise, Climbing park, hiking trails (For seasoned hikers and general strolls too). During Christmas you can even visit the house of Santa Claus in a grotto on the Rochers-de-Naye.

mainEntity.name: What is the cost of the Rochers De Naye?

acceptedAnswer.text: The cost of Rochers De Naye is CHF 70 per person (Full fare rate) and CHF 30 per person (Swiss Pass holder fare).

mainEntity.name: What is the discount offered on Rochers De Naye with the Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: For passengers holding a valid Swiss Travel Pass, Rochers De Naye is available at a discounted rate of CHF 30 per adult. Children below 16 years travel free when holding a valid family card.

mainEntity.name: What is the total duration taken to reach Rochers De Naye?

acceptedAnswer.text: It takes only 55 minutes to reach the summit of Rochers De Naye on the cog railway.

mainEntity.name: Are there restaurants available on Rochers De Naye?

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a restaurant with panoramic views (Restaurant - Plein Roc) and a self-service café (Restaurant -Alpin) with tasty local dishes and snacks.

mainEntity.name: When can one visit the House of Santa Claus on Rochers De Naye?

acceptedAnswer.text: The house of Santa Claus in a grotto on the Rochers-de-Naye can be visited between November and December.

Product.name: Jungfraujoch
Product.description: The most visited mountain of Switzerland – Jungfraujoch – is not only on the top of our list but is also recognised as the Top of Europe. Apart from exhibiting the breathtaking view of Swiss Alps, Jungfrau also offers an Ice Palace, Alpine Sensation, shopping, and outdoor snow activities.

mainEntity.name: How much does Jungfrau cost with the Swiss Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: The cost of Jungfrau is seasonal. The Swiss Pass holder rate is CHF 138 (Upto May then Sept to Oct) / CHF 155.00 (From June - Aug), CHF 118 (Nov - Dec)

mainEntity.name: How does one reach Jungfraujoch?

acceptedAnswer.text: From Interlaken Ost station take a train to Lauterbrunnen or Grindelwald. After this journey, change trains to reach Kleine Scheidegg. From Kleine Scheidegg, ride the Jungfrau Railway directly to Jungfraujoch – Top of Europe.

mainEntity.name: Is there any other route apart from the regular Lauterbrunnen to reach Jungfraujoch?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, to reach Jungfrau, you can take the alternative route via Grindelwald: Interlaken – Grindelwald - Kleine Scheidegg - Top of Jungfraujoch.

mainEntity.name: What are the various activities available at Jungfrau?

acceptedAnswer.text: The various activities available on Jungfraujoch are as follows: Alpine Sensations, Ice Palace, Ski & Snowboard Park, Snow tubing/sledging, The Sphinx observation terrace are some of the activities available on Jungfrau.

mainEntity.name: What activities are free on Jungfrau?

acceptedAnswer.text: Alpine Sensations, Ice Palace, The Sphinx observation terrace are actitivies which are free of cost on Jungfrau.

mainEntity.name: Is there an Indian Restaurant on Jungfrau?

acceptedAnswer.text: Jungfrau has 3 restaurants - Crystal, Aletsch, and Bollywood. Bollywood restaurant serves Indian cuisine.

mainEntity.name: Will I get snow on Jungfrau even during the summer months?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Jungfrau has guaranteed snow 365 days a year. Jungfrau’s cold weather is one of the reasons why Jungfrau is among the most popular excursions in Switzerland.

mainEntity.name: Do children get a discounted rate on Jungfrau tickets?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, children below 16 years of age holding a family card and travelling with atleast one parent holding a valid Swiss pass, travels free of cost.

mainEntity.name: What is journey like to Jungfrau from Interlaken OST station?

acceptedAnswer.text: Jungfraujoch is the highest railway station in Europe located at 3,454 metres above sea level. The entire journey is by train. You have a few photo stops on the way before you reach the summit and enjoy views of the glacier.

mainEntity.name: How long does the journey take from Interlaken OST to Jungfrau?

acceptedAnswer.text: It takes about 2 hours to reach to the summit of Jungfraujoch. The journey is by train.

mainEntity.name: When is the best time to visit Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: The best time to visit Switzerland is between April – June when you can enjoy sunny weather and clear skies.

mainEntity.name: Do you require guided tours to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, you do not require guided tours to Switzerland. Switzerland as a country is very simple to journey through. You have information counters (i) in nearly all cities, where you can ask for suggestions, have your queries addressed, purchase tickets/passes if need be. The country has signboards and directions signs placed in almost every street that make it easy to navigate. The locals too are always willing to help in case of any difficulty.

mainEntity.name: On an average, how many days should one travel to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: In order to cover the basic, most visited cities in Switzerland, you should travel for about 8 – 10 days. If you have 8 days Switzerland itinerary then you won’t have to rush through your vacation and you have enough time to do a city tour, do a few mountains excursions and hop on to a cruise.

mainEntity.name: What is the approximate cost for an 8 Days Switzerland package?

acceptedAnswer.text: The approximate cost for an 8 Days 7 Nights land Switzerland package would cost INR 1,32,000/- based on apartment stay for 2 adults and 2 children (below 10 years)(Approximate rate based on travel dates in May).

mainEntity.name: What is best way to travel around Switzerland while you’re on tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: The best way to travel is to use public transportation in Switzerland. They’re perfectly interlinked to each city, making sure you reach your final destination with ease. The Swiss Travel Pass makes it easy to use any mode of public transportation like trains, busses, trams, boats. You also get discounted rates on mountain excursions.

mainEntity.name: Should one go for group tours or individual family tours while travelling to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: It is recommended that one opts for an individual family tour over group tour simply because you have the flexibility of choosing your own time and places to move around. You are not bound to a fixed time table, you can make changes to your plan whenever you want to. It would typically be ‘your own family’ vacation at a relaxed pace.

mainEntity.name: For someone travelling to Switzerland for the first time, what are the excursions they must do?

acceptedAnswer.text: Passengers travelling to Switzerland for the first time usually prefer excursions to < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/mountain-excursion/1-jungfraujoch-top-of-europe'>Jungfraujoch, < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/mountain-excursion/5-mount-titlis'>Mount Titlis and < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/mountain-excursion/7-matterhorn-glacier-paradise'>Matterhorn Glacier Paradise – they’re extremely popular among families too.

mainEntity.name: For someone travelling to Switzerland for the first time, what are the cities they should base themselves in?

acceptedAnswer.text: For passengers travelling to Switzerland for the first time, it is recommended that they base themselves in central parts of Switzerland – Interlaken or Lucerne. If passengers have a longer duration of stay, they can add Zermatt to the package as well.

mainEntity.name: Which countries can I add on to a Switzerland tour in case I want to extend my holiday?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you want to add other countries to your Switzerland tour, you have the option of the following: Paris & Nice (France), Munich, Freiburg, Frankfurt (Germany), Innsbruck, Salzburg, Vienna (Austria), Venice, Rome, Florence (Italy).

mainEntity.name: What is a better accommodation choice for Switzerland packages? Apartments or Hotel stay

acceptedAnswer.text: The choice of accommodation between apartments and hotels completely depends on the passenger type and passengers' number. Most families prefer staying in an apartment to accommodate the family together, whereas solo travellers or a friends circle would prefer hotels. Apartments have the facility of accommodating larger groups together. Hotels can accommodate 1 – 4 passengers in a room (varies from Hotel to Hotel). Hotels include breakfast and apartments have a kitchenette where you can make your own meals, so passengers who have specific meal requirements opt for apartments, whereas those who do not want to cook opt for hotels.

mainEntity.name: Is it possible to do a 3 or 4 days Switzerland package?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it is possible to have a 3 or 4 days Switzerland holiday package. You can include just the basics like accommodation in a central location – Interlaken or Lucerne and include 1 or 2 of the excursions like – Jungfrau and/or Mt Titlis.

mainEntity.name: Is it better to opt for self-drive inclusive tours to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: Self-drive inclusive tours work for passengers who do not want the hassle of travelling on and off public transportation. The issue of carrying your luggage around the city is also taken care of. Cost-wise, the car option could turn out to be cheaper depending on the type of car you take.

mainEntity.name: What are the entry and exit points for a Switzerland package?

acceptedAnswer.text: The entry and exit points for a Switzerland tour are Zurich as the main hub of the Airline are Zurich. Swiss International Airlines have direct flights from Mumbai and Delhi to Zurich.

mainEntity.name: Are winter months a good time to book a package to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, if you love the winter season and are can put up with the low temperatures, then you can travel between November – mid-February. Snow clad mountains, trees and streets are sights that you would enjoy during these months. The Christmas markets should also be on your to-do list in December. Check out < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/blog/10-reason-to-visit-things-to-do-in-switzerland-in-winter'>things to do in Switzerland in winter

mainEntity.name: While travelling on a tour to Switzerland, what are the foods and drinks that you have to try?

acceptedAnswer.text: When travelling to Switzerland, the various food options that one must try are Cheese Fondue, Raclette and Rösti. Switzerland is popular for its vineyards, so you cannot miss out on the local wine produce. One such example is the Glühwein - a richly spiced wine which is usually consumed during winter. Check out < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/blog/foods-and-drinks-to-try-in-switzerland'>foods and drinks to try in Switzerland

mainEntity.name: What is Switzerland famous for?

acceptedAnswer.text: Switzerland is famous for various reasons. Some of them that top the list are: Swiss Chocolates, Cheese variety, local wine and beer, watches, Swiss Army Knife, iconic Matterhorn mountain, scenic trains, and of course mountains, lakes, cows and chalets.

mainEntity.name: What are some romantic cities that one can include in a Switzerland package?

acceptedAnswer.text: Apart from Interlaken and Lucerne, some romantic cities that one can include in a < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/switzerland-tour-packages'>Switzerland holiday package are Montreux, Lausanne, St Moritz, Lugano, Zermatt, Gstaad, Leukerbad.

mainEntity.name: Are there any adventure activities that you can include in a Switzerland package?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, there are a lot of adventure activities that you can include in a Switzerland package. Some of them are < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/mountain-excursion/9-grindelwald-first'>Grindelwald First (First Flyer, First Glider, Mountain Cart, and Trotti Bike), < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/mountain-excursion/19-jetboat-interlaken'>Jetboat ride in Interlaken, < a href='https://www.swisstours.com/mountain-excursion/4-glacier-3000'>Glacier 3000 (try the alpine coaster or take a ride on the Ice Express Chairlift, or walk on the suspension bridge), Titlis (walk on Europe’s highest suspension bridge - Titlis Cliff Walk, or try mountain biking, climbing, scootering).

mainEntity.name: Which train journeys can you add to your Switzerland package?

acceptedAnswer.text: There are many train options you can add to your Switzerland package, depending on your routing. These include The Golden Passline Panoramic train, The Glacier Express, The Bernina Express. The Golden Passline can be included in your regular routines in Switzerland, Glacier express runs from Zermatt to St Moritz and vice versa. The Bernina Express runs between Tirano and St Moritz. Chocolate Train is another option that even kids would enjoy – The ride takes you to the Chocolate and Cheese factory in Broc and Gruyeres.

mainEntity.name: Are apartments a good accommodation option to include in a Switzerland package?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it’s a good option to include apartments in your Switzerland package. Depending on the number of passengers travelling, they turn out to be an economical option. Larger families can stay together under one roof (Which may not be possible in Hotels). Apartments in most cities are located centrally – like in Zurich, Lucerne, Interlaken, Grindelwald, Basel, Zermatt. Some are even close to the bus/train station, grocery stores, sightseeing places. They are available in a range of 3*, 3* deluxe, 4*, 4* deluxe and 5* options (Zermatt offers luxurious properties)

Blog.headline: Foods and Drinks to Try in Switzerland
Blog.description: The foods and drinks to try in Switzerland are beyond hot chocolate and types of cheese. There are many Swiss delicacies that only locals are aware of. Therefore, at SWISStours, we have compiled a list of top foods and drinks in Switzerland every tourist should try.

mainEntity.name: What is the top must try food and drinks in Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Switzerland is famous for a lot of tempting dishes and its not just cheese and chocolate! Some of the dishes and drinks that one should not miss during their trip to Switzerland are:
  1. Swiss Cheese Fondue
  2. Raclette
  3. Rösti
  4. Basel Flour Soup - Basler Mehlsuppe
  5. Alplermagronen
  6. Swiss Wine and Beer
  7. Hot Chocolate
  8. Glühwein - Spiced red wine
  9. Swiss Desserts (Zuger Kirschtorte, Raspberry cake, Bündner Nusstorte) and Gelato
  10. Swiss Chocolate

mainEntity.name: What food is Switzerland famous for?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Apart from Jungfraujoch & Titlis and other mountains, Switzerland is famous for Cheese and Chocolates. Some of the popular dishes include cheese, potato and bread as the main ingredients. Switzerland is extremely famous for the following food items:
  1. Swiss Cheese Fondue
  2. Raclette
  3. Rösti

mainEntity.name: What are some Swiss beverages you must try when in your Switzerland tour?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Some of the Swiss beverages you must try in your Switzerland tour:
  1. Wine: There are vineyards all over Switzerland, so one must try its local produce. Among the more famous names are St. Saphorin, Dezalay and Epesses.
  2. Beer: Switzerland has 650 registered breweries. Each region in Switzerland has its own speciality the popular ones are the Namur Express, Blanche Weiner, Ueli Laggs Special etc.
  3. Hot Chocolate: Hot chocolate is the go-to drink in Switzerland in winter. Keep looking for Heisse Schoggi/Heisse Schokolade in the menu card.
  4. Glühwein - Spiced red wine: This is a Christmas special drink but also consumed all winter in Switzerland.

mainEntity.name: What are some popular desserts that you should try in your Switzerland tour package?

acceptedAnswer.text: Desserts are extremely popular in Switzerland. Try the Berliner (doughnut), Zuger Kirschtorte (Swiss layered cake), Raspberry cake, Swiss yoghurt, Bündner Nusstorte (nut tart), Pain au chocolate and Gelato that is made from fruits, nuts, chocolate, coffee. Take some time off during your trip and give these desserts a try.

mainEntity.name: Which chocolates are popular and must try in your Swiss tour package?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chocolate brands like Lindt, Caillers, Toblerone, and Milka are popular in Switzerland and have become famous worldwide for their creamy textures and excellent varieties.

mainEntity.name: Does Switzerland has a train dedicated to Chocolates?

acceptedAnswer.text: Switzerland is well known for chocolate, and even has a train dedicated to chocolate! This popular train which is called the Chocolate train takes you to the the Nestle-Cailler factory where you can see the process of manufacturing chocolates. One should surely add this chocolate train trip if your kids are travelling with you. And if you have a Swiss Train Pass you are entitled to a discounted rate of the Chocolate Train tour in Switzerland.

mainEntity.name: Is food in Switzerland expensive?

acceptedAnswer.text: Switzerland may have an amazing number of Michelin starred restaurants (128 in 2019) and could be expensive, but good and affordable Swiss food can be found at small local restaurants, grocery stores, food halls etc.

mainEntity.name: What is Glühwein in Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: Glühwein is basically mulled / spiced red wine. It is not the typically sweet kind of wine but a richly spiced one. It’s a Christmas special drink but also consumed all winter in Switzerland. You’ll find these at Christmas markets. And if you are planning your Switzerland tour package for couple in Christmas then this is must try.

mainEntity.name: Are there restaurants available on the mountains in Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, most mountains in Switzerland have restaurants operational. One can take a trip up to the mountain spend a couple of hours there, have lunch or a snack at the restaurant and then start descending back down. Try a glass of wine at the mighty Jungfraujoch, traditional fondue at Glacier 3000 or even Alplermagronen (local macaroni with cheese and potato) at Stanserhorn.

Blog.headline: In-depth Switzerland Itinerary 8 Days by Swiss Travel Experts
Blog.description: If you are looking to get the most out of your Switzerland itinerary for 8 days, then you have come to the right blog. This Swiss itinerary is from a Swiss travel expert's personal, unforgettable experience. Read: A step-by-step, comprehensive 8 days Switzerland itinerary.

mainEntity.name: Which cities should an 8 days Swiss itinerary include if you want to cover the country in depth??

acceptedAnswer.text: For an 8 days Switzerland itinerary, if you’d like to cover Switzerland in depth, you can stay in cities like Montreux (3 nights), Interlaken (4 nights) and Zurich (1 night). From these cities day trips to Zermatt, Gstaad, Lucerne, Grindelwald can be done.

mainEntity.name: What all can you cover in Montreux in a day, during you trip to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you’re staying in Montreux, or doing a day trip to Montreux during your Switzerland trip, you can cover the Chillion Castle and a basic walk around the city. The castle is just 15 mins away by bus from Montreux. Once you cover the castle, take the bus back to the Montreux Market or casino area and start walking. Head towards the spotless old town and back to the Lake Geneva area. When you reach at the top of Montreux Old Town you get a mesmerizing panoramic view of the quaint town of Montreux. It’ll take approximately 1 hour or more to walk the whole area, but totally worth it.

mainEntity.name: If you have about 2-3 nights in Montreux, Switzerland, what all can you cover?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you’re travelling to Switzerland and staying in Montreux for 2 – 3 nights, you can do the Chillon Castle, followed by a walk at the Montreux promenade area. The next day take a day to the village of Zermatt. There’s lots of things do in Zermatt, one of which is an excursion to Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. The third day, take a trip to Gstaad and visit the small village of Saanen, followed by Chocolate and Cheese factory located in Gruyeres and Broc.

mainEntity.name: If you have planned an 8 days trip to Switzerland and are in Interlaken for 4 nights, what all can you do?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you have planned an 8 days Switzerland tour package and are in Interlaken for 4 nights you can spend your first day at leisure and walk between Interlaken OST and West, where you’ll come across some nice cafes, boutiques, and shops selling famous brands, or take a cruise on Lake Brienz. The second and third day you have excursions to Grindelwald First (great for adventure lovers) and Jungfraujoch - These are the main highlights of Interlaken. On the last day, take a day trip to Lucerne and cover the Chapel Bridge, Lion Monument and Musegg wall. Cruises are possible from Lucerne as well.

mainEntity.name: During an 8 days trip to Switzerland, how many nights are needed in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you are planning an 8 days Switzerland holiday package, you can stay in Zurich for 1 or 2 nights. Some people use it only as an exit point and thus stay for only a night. Even if you have just 1 night, you can cover the Rhine Falls in Zurich, take a walk on the Bahnhofstrasse – the shopping street of Zurich. Zurich is also well-known for its nightlife, and you’ll find many pubs and bars around.

mainEntity.name: What are the things you can cover from Gstaad when on your trip to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text:
When you’re on your Switzerland trip and are looking to cover Gstaad, you can cover Saanen, Gruyere, and Broc.
Saanen: A small village – very famous for some Bollywood movies shot there.
Gruyere: Famous for its cheese factory located here: La Maison Du Gruyere. A factory visit is possible, followed by a walk in the village.
Broc: Know for Maison Callier – the famous Chocolate Factory is located here. A visit to the factory is possible. You can either cover the Cheese and chocolate factory on your own, or book a Chocolate Train from Montreux that takes you to both these places.

mainEntity.name: Is a day trip to Lucerne possible if you have planned your stay in Interlaken?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, a day trip to Lucerne is possible if you have planned your stay in Interlaken. You would have to leave early to cover Lucerne well. You have the option of doing a basic city tour of Lucerne (covered under the Swiss Rail Pass), followed by the Swiss Transport Musuem - the world's largest transport museums. The Swiss Transport Musuem will take you an entire day if you want to cover all parts within. An alternative would be to cover an excursion like Titlis, Pilatus, Stanserhorn or Rigi. If you do not want to rush through the day, then a city tour plus a boat cruise is good enough.

mainEntity.name: If you’re planning an 8 days tour package to Switzerland, what are the important highlights to include?

acceptedAnswer.text:
If you’re planning an 8 days tour package to Switzerland, some important highlights you must include are:
  1. Jungfraujoch and Grindelwald from Interlaken
  2. Swiss Transport Musuem OR an excursion to Titlis / Pilatus in Lucerne
  3. Rhine Falls from Zurich
  4. Matterhorn Glacier Paradise from Zermatt
  5. Chillon Castle and Chocolate and Cheese factory from Montreux
. For most of these highlights, you will get a discounted rate with the Swiss Travel Pass.

mainEntity.name: If you want a little relaxed tour to Switzerland for 8 days instead of rushing through, what kind of itinerary is suggested?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you’re look for a much-relaxed tour to Switzerland for 8 days rather than including too many cities and rushing through, we suggest you cover only 2-3 main or central cities in Switzerland like Interlaken, Lucerne and Zermatt or Zurich. Interlaken and Lucerne are centrally located and has a lot of things to do at your own pace, while Zermatt is a car-free resort home to one of the most photographed mountain. Zurich on the other hand won't just be your entry and exit point, but a place where you’d experience the highest waterfall, or FIFA musuem for sport enthusiasts.

mainEntity.name: What's the easiest way to travel around Switzerland if you have an 8 Days itinerary?

acceptedAnswer.text: The best and the easiest way to travel around Switzerland if you have an 8 days itinerary, is to purchase an 8 days Swiss Travel Pass that gives you full coverage throughout your Switzerland trip. It not only includes your public transportation within the country, but also offers discounts on various mountain excursions and free entry to various other excursions.

Blog.headline: 10 Ultimate Things to do in Switzerland
Blog.description: As you are planning things to do in Switzerland, you may know that this beautiful country offers far more than snow-capped mountains and mesmerising views of lush greenery. Reading a plethora of blogs, articles, or vlogs, it indeed becomes overwhelming to choose things to do in Switzerland, as each of the travellers shares their own experiences and recommendation. But worry not. SWISStours team of Swiss experts – who have travelled across Switzerland many times – have compiled a list of 10 things to do in Switzerland.

mainEntity.name: What are the things one must cover from Interlaken, Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: Someone travelling to Interlaken must cover Jungfraujoch which is the most visited mountain. For those who seek adventure Interlaken has Grindelwald First that offers great views and activities like First Flyer, First Glider, Mountain Cart, and Trotti Bike. Take the Jet Boat ride to cover lake Brienz in an exciting way. A short excursion to Harder Kulm offers the best views of Interlaken at 1322 meters above sea level.

mainEntity.name: What are the things you must cover if you have Lucerne added in your Switzerland itinerary?

acceptedAnswer.text: There a lot of things to cover in Lucerne for you Switzerland itinerary, you must consider covering Mt Titlis – The 360-degree experience on Titlis Rotair as it is something one shouldn't miss. At Pilatus, you can experience world’s steepest cogwheel railway. Swiss Transport Musuem is an ideal place to discover the history of transportation and also houses a film theatre, planetarium and Swiss Chocolate Adventure. Stanserhorn will give you the most memorable moments as you ride in the CabriO - the world's first open double-decker cable car. There are several cruises on Lake Lucerne that you can add to your package too.

mainEntity.name: Is it worth adding Glacier 3000 to a Switzerland itinerary?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it is totally worth adding Glacier 3000 to a Switzerland itinerary as it offers glorious alpine views of Jungfrau, Matterhorn, and Mont Blanc at 3000 meters above sea level and also has the famous Peak Walk by Tissot, Ice Express Chairlift, snow bus, Alpine coaster, Dogsled rides etc. The mountain can be reached from Gstaad train station and is available at a discounted rate with the Swiss Rail Pass.

mainEntity.name: What are the popular museums and parks one must add to the Swiss itinerary when travelling with kids?

acceptedAnswer.text: In our things to do in Switzerland list, Swissminiatur is a bonus; however, for many avid travellers, especially with kids, it ranks at the very first position. Swissminiatur park is Switzerland's largest open-air miniature museum in Lugano, which has 128 intricately-designed hand-made models of iconic buildings, and means of transport of Switzerland that are fully-functional. Switzerland's most visited museum and the country's largest museum - Swiss Museum of Transport in Lucerne, which has a lot of interactive activities and experiences. These are 2 popular things to do in Switzerland that kids and adults would enjoy.

mainEntity.name: Which mountains in Switzerland have adventure activities?

acceptedAnswer.text: For someone looking for adventure activities on a mountain, Switzerland has mountains like Grindelwald First in Interlaken, Titlis in Lucerne, Glacier 3000 in Gstaad and Matterhorn Glacier Paradise in Zermatt (mostly for those interested in skiing and hiking). These excursions are covered on the Swiss Travel Pass and are available at discounted rates.

mainEntity.name: What is the Stanserhorn CabriO?

acceptedAnswer.text: The CabriO is the world's first open double-decker cable car. You can experience it while riding up to Stanserhorn (from Stans, Lucerne). This one-of-its-kind cable car is a convertible-car-like open roof, allowing you to enjoy 360-degree panoramic views. An unmissable thing to do in Switzerland in summer when it comes to fun, experience, adventure, nature, romance, and even delicious cuisine. This is included in the Swiss Train Pass .

mainEntity.name: What are the things to do in Switzerland that can be done in half days' time?

acceptedAnswer.text:
If you’re travelling to Switzerland and do not want to spend the entire day in an excursion or activity, the following are some things you can do that can be covered in half days' time:
  • Jet Boat – From Interlaken, this boat ride on Lake Brienz is exciting and adventurous and has a duration of 75 mins (depending on your booking)
  • Harder Kulm – From Interlaken, a small funicular ride that takes you to the top of the mountain for the best views of Interlaken.
  • Stanserhorn – From Lucerne, a combination of a vintage funicular ride and an open roof, double-decker cable car ride (this ride takes 6 and a half minutes) offers views of Alps and 10 Swiss lakes.
  • Rhine Falls – From Zurich, the biggest waterfalls in Europe takes approximately an hour’s time by train from Zurich station. It is included Swiss Rail Pass.

mainEntity.name: Is Jungfraujoch worth the price?

acceptedAnswer.text: The most visited mountain of Switzerland - Jungfraujoch is recognised as the Top of Europe. It is one of the most popular things to do in Switzerland. Jungfrau is one of the more expensive mountains, so holding the Swiss Travel Pass offers a discounted rate and is helpful, especially since your kids under 16 years of age will travel free if you hold the pass.

mainEntity.name: Which is the most photographed mountain in Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: One of the main tourist attractions of Switzerland and the most photographed is the Matterhorn. The view of the pyramid shaped peak of the Matterhorn reveals itself in all its majestic glory and tells you exactly why it is the most photographed mountain in the world. There are various points from which one can try to get the best views of this mountain and one such is the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise.

Blog.headline: 10 Ultimate Benefits of Swiss Travel Pass - The Rail Pass of Switzerland

mainEntity.name: Does the Swiss Train Pass really help in reducing your expense cost during your Switzerland trip?

mainEntity.name: How is using a Swiss travel pass convenient and easy?

Swiss Passes are also available as an e-pass, so you always have access to it on your cell phone.

acceptedAnswer.text: One of the best benefits of Swiss Travel Pass is that it helps you save a lot of money when compared to the cost of buying excursions and public transport tickets individually. acceptedAnswer.text:
The various benefits of a Switzerland Travel Pass are:
  1. Unlimited travel by rail, road, and bus

Switzerland Travel Pass holders are entitled to a discounted rate on Harder Kulm full fare price. The reduction is roughly 50%.

mainEntity.name: What is the discount on the Chocolate train with the Swiss Rail Pass?
