Blog.headline: A Detailed Guide on 5 Nights 6 Days Switzerland Itinerary
Blog.description: Encapsulating the best of Switzerland, this blog explains step-by-step on how to prepare 5 nights 6 days Switzerland itinerary. Usually, with such less days, crafting a Switzerland itinerary becomes an overwhelming process. However, at SWISStours, we have laid down on how to capture the essence of Switzerland in 6 days.

mainEntity.name: What's the ideal 6 days Switzerland itinerary?

acceptedAnswer.text: An ideal 5 nights 6 days Switzerland package will include 2 nights in Lucerne, 2 nights Interlaken and 1 night Zurich.

mainEntity.name: When travelling for 5 nights to Switzerland, what are the main highlights that you can cover?

acceptedAnswer.text: In 5 nights Switzerland tour package, the main highlights that you can cover are Rhine falls – Zurich, Mount Titlis, Jungfrau - Top of Europe, Jetboat in Interlaken, Harder Kulm. Other local highlights like the FIFA museum and Trummelbach Falls can be covered. And if you are a Swiss Travel Pass holder you can avail discounted rates and other swiss pass benefits on mountain excursion.

mainEntity.name: During the 6 Days Switzerland trip, how many nights should one stay in Interlaken for?

acceptedAnswer.text: There many things to do in Interlaken, but, for 6 days Swiss tour package, we recommend minimum for 2 nights stay in Interlaken, in which you can cover the city and its main attractions like Jungfrau, Harder Kulm, Jetboat ride, etc.

mainEntity.name: During the 6 Days Switzerland trip, how many nights should one stay in Lucerne for?

acceptedAnswer.text: There many things to do in Lucerne, but, for 6 days Swiss tour package, 2 nights stay in Lucerne is sufficient to cover main attractions like Mt. Titlis, and a local city tour.

mainEntity.name: How many days Swiss Pass is required if you’re travelling to Switzerland for 6 days 5 nights?

acceptedAnswer.text: For 6 days Switzerland itinerary package, one can opt for 8 Days Swiss Rail Pass.

mainEntity.name: Is there any scenic train that can be added in a 5 Nights 6 days Swiss tour package?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, there is a scenic train that runs between Interlaken - Lucerne or vice versa called the ‘Lucerne Interlaken Express’ panoramic train. It is a part of the Golden Pass Line and is covered in the Swiss Train Pass as well (reservations not included).

mainEntity.name: While booking 5 nights 6 days to Switzerland trip, is it recommended to add a night in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, when you’re booking a 5 nights 6 days Switzerland tour package, it is suggested you add a night in Zurich. This way you wouldn’t have to leave for the airport very early in the morning on the day of your flight, and you have a chance of covering the important highlights of Zurich city like the Rhine falls, FIFA museum, Zurich museum etc, all of which are included in benefits of Switzerland Travel Pass.

mainEntity.name: During the 6 days Switzerland tour package, would the Swiss Travel Pass cover the journey from Zurich Airport to the main cities?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, with the help of the 8 days Swiss Pass, your 6 days Switzerland trip will be covered entirely, and the journey from Zurich Airport to the main cities and back is covered. The journey between these cities and the airport would be by train.

mainEntity.name: Will the Swiss Travel Pass cover the local attractions in Switzerland during the 6 days package?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Yes, the Swiss Travel Pass includes many benefits and this os one one of them free entries to local attractions and museums in Switzerland like in
Lucerne: Lion Monument and Chapel bridge
Interlaken: Trummelbach Falls
Zurich: the Rhine falls, FIFA museum, Zurich museum

mainEntity.name: When you arrive at Zurich Airport during your Switzerland trip, is there a locker facility?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, when you arrive at Zurich Airport you can keep your luggage at the airport locker where you get small, medium and large sizes lockers and that can be used for up to 72 hours. You then have the option to cover things do in Zurich.

mainEntity.name: Since check in to hotels and apartments happen only in the afternoon in most cities in Switzerland, can you leave the luggage at the airport on arrival?

acceptedAnswer.text: Since most flights land early morning at Zurich airport, you can keep your luggage at the Airport locker where you get small, medium and large sizes lockers and that can be used for up to 72 hours. You then have the option of covering some sightseeing around the city for about 2-3 hours, pick your luggage again and move to the Hotel.

mainEntity.name: Which country is a good choice for honeymoon?

Every little town and village is so picturesque and offers so many experiences. You have cruise options, mountain excursions, thermal spas, adventure activities – all in one country.

mainEntity.name: What are the main cities that you must cover if you’re planning a honeymoon package to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text:
If someone’s planning a honeymoon package to Switzerland and wants to cover the main cities within a short duration, they can include places like:

Lucerne: Stanserhorn that has a unique open top double decker cable car, Mt Rigi which has one of the best baths and spas.
Zurich: Visit the Mühlesteg Bridge to lock your love with a Love-lock before tossing the key into the river.

mainEntity.name: What are some off beat destinations that you can cover if you’re planning a honeymoon to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text:
If you’re looking for some off beat destinations to cover when planning your honeymoon package to Switzerland, try these cities:
Leukerbad - largest thermal spa resort in the Alps
Montreux – for its lake promenade and castle
St Moritz – Kulm spa to unwind with views of St Moritz Lake
Lugano – Visit the romantic lakeshore village of Morcote.

mainEntity.name: What is a suggested itinerary for a honeymoon package to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: Depending on the number of days you want to travel for, a suggested Switzerland honeymoon package itinerary would include Interlaken, Lucerne, Zurich for a tour from 4 nights to 6 nights, add cities like Montreux, Lugano, St Moritz if you can extend your tour to 7 nights to 9 nights. The Swiss rail pass would cover travel between these cities.

Blog.headline: 10 Things to do in Switzerland in Winter
Blog.description: Switzerland in winter not only attracts tourists from across the world but also has a huge chunk of domestic and European tourists especially from neighbouring countries like Germany due to its amazing winter activities – and skiing is just one of them! Other than nature, Switzerland in winter is abuzz with events, Christmas markets, winter sports and events that make for a fantastic holiday. Here are just some of the fun things that you can do if you are travelling to Switzerland in winter.

mainEntity.name: Is winter a good time to plan Switzerland trip?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, winter is a good time to plan your Switzerland tour package. Switzerland in winter not only attracts tourists from across the world, but also has a huge chunk of domestic and European tourists. Switzerland in winter is abuzz with events, Christmas markets, winter sports and events that make for an amazing holiday.

mainEntity.name: When is the best time to travel to Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text: Switzerland is beautiful all year round but, in the winter, when the mountains turn totally white and there is a fresh crispiness to the air, the charm is only doubled. A lot of domestic tourists travel to Switzerland in summer, but in the winters too, there’s a huge chunk of domestic and European tourists especially from neighbouring countries like Germany due to its amazing winter activities. It is arguably the most popular summer and winter destination in all of central Europe.

mainEntity.name: Why should I plan my vacation to Switzerland in winter?

acceptedAnswer.text: You should plan your trip to Switzerland in winters because apart from white valleys and snowy peaks, Switzerland in winter is abuzz with events, Christmas markets, winter sports that make for an amazing holiday.

mainEntity.name: What are some of the Christmas markets to visit in Switzerland during winters?

acceptedAnswer.text: Among the more popular markets to visit in Switzerland in the winter are the ones in Basel, Bern, Montreux and Zurich. Smaller towns like Rapperswiil, Murten and Stein Am Rhein also hold beautiful Christmas markets.

mainEntity.name: What are the various things to do during the winter season in Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The various things to do during winters in Switzerland are:
  1. Glacier Express train journey - The most popular train journey in Switzerland connecting Zermatt to St Moritz (the main winter destinations).
  2. Christmas Markets - By mid-November, many small and big towns put up their Christmas markets that are a huge tourist draw.
  3. Thermal Spas - Soaking up in an outdoor pool, in waters that can range somewhere near 23 to 43 degrees Celcius.
  4. Fondue in the Alps – Try some hot melted cheese with toasty flavors surrounded by winter landscape high up on a mountain.
  5. Ice Rinks – Try the skating rink in Interlaken.
  6. Igloo Village – Try staying at the igloo village in Zermatt with a view of the Matterhorn!

mainEntity.name: What are some of the best places to cover in Switzerland trip during winters?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The 2 most popular winter destinations to cover in your Switzerland trip are Zermatt and St. Moritz. You can also include other places for their activities such as for
Christmas markets: Basel, Bern, Montreux and Zurich
Ice rinks:Interlaken in the center of the city.
Lake side town Lucerne is popular for the Chapel bridge and mountains like Mount Pilatus, Mount Titlis, Rigi and Stanserhorn.

mainEntity.name: Are mountain excursions open to tourists in Switzerland during winters?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Switzerland being a winter destination has mountains open to tourists even in winters. Excursions to Rigi, Jungfrau, Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, Glacier 3000 and even Jetboat are open in winters.

mainEntity.name: Does Switzerland have mineral and thermal spas open in winters?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Switzerland does have a lot of outdoor pools and spas open throughout the year. Some of the most popular ones are Leukerbad Thermal Spa - Europe's largest Alpine Thermal Spa, Mineralbad, Spa Rigi Kaltbad, the Thermalbad and Spa-Zurich. St Moritz too, is a popular winter resort known for its natural springs.

mainEntity.name: Why are the Christmas markets so popular in Switzerland and a must during winter for travellers?

acceptedAnswer.text: Christmas markets with their Christmas trees, twinkling lights and carols (sometimes choirs) just make the already beautiful surroundings more magical in Switzerland and therefore is a must for anyone travelling during winters. These markets are popular because they have all kinds of stalls selling locally produced foods and drinks (cheese, preserves, gingerbread, wines!), an array of Christmas buntings, clothes, artefacts and jewellery. There are skating rinks and other entertainment rides that the kids can enjoy as well.

mainEntity.name: What are the most famous winter destinations in Switzerland?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Switzerland as a country is beautiful and magical during winters. However, there are two main destinations that will truly make your trip memorable:
St. Moritz: It is the prime winter sport destination that tourists travel to. Other than skiing St Moritz also has ice skating rinks, bob sledding, curling and tobogganing for non-skiers. It is also famous for its natural springs.
Zermatt: A car free town is Switzerland's winter paradise. Try a romantic night's stay at the Igloo Village, along with views of Matterhorn, some cheese fondue and mulled wine. Visit Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, which is also a skier's paradise. The city also offers sledding, paragliding, and more.

Blog.headline: 10 Things to do in Zurich, Switzerland by Swiss Travel Expert
Blog.description: Zurich is far from the just the commercial and financial hub that it is made out to be. One can easily spend a few nights exploring the town and its surroundings and still be left wanting for more. To help you make up your mind on spending time in this city, here are the Top 10 things that you can do on your next visit to Zurich.

mainEntity.name: For how many nights should I stay in Zurich for my Switzerland trip package?

acceptedAnswer.text: A lot of passengers use Zurich only as a hub to arrive and depart from Switzerland, not realising there are so many, things to do in Zurich. Places like the Zurich Zoo, Rhine falls, Uetliberg etc. take long to cover so it is advisable to stay for at least one or two nights in Zurich.

mainEntity.name: Is Zurich worth including in Switzerland itinerary?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, since there are a lot of things to do in Zurich, you'd need more than just a day to cover the main highlights in your Switzerland tour.

mainEntity.name: Does the Swiss Travel Pass cover any sightseeing in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, some places like the Swiss National Museum, Uetliberg, FIFA Museum, Rhine falls (specific route only) etc. are covered in the Swiss Passes.

mainEntity.name: What sights can I include in Zurich in my Switzerland Tour Package?

acceptedAnswer.text:
There are lot of things that you can cover during your stay in Zurich.
For families travelling with kids, Zurich Zoo is a must.
For sports enthusiasts the Fifa Musuem.
For people who don’t mind a good walk or a small hike Uetliberg is a good option
For leisure passengers a cruise on the lake or Rhine falls is a good choice.
Along with these, local attractions like the Old Town (Altstadt), Bahnofstrasse, Grossmunster and Fraumunster can be covered. Make sure you plan your Switzerland tour package accordingly.

mainEntity.name: What sights can I cover as a day trip to Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you plan to cover Zurich as a day trip only, you would be able to do a Zurich city tour and can include local highlights like the Old Town (Altstadt), Bahnofstrasse, Grossmunster and Fraumunster, Swiss National Musuem, Zurich Lake (Limmat), the Lindenhof hill etc. Time permitting, add Rhine Falls to the list. If you do not want to do the local highlights, you can directly opt for the Rhine Falls or enjoy panoramic views from Üetliberg - Zurich’s little mountain.

mainEntity.name: What is the ideal way of covering a day in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: An ideal way of covering a day in Zurich is to take a trip to Rhine Falls, followed by local city tour of Zurich. To reach Rhine Falls, take the train to Neuhausen or Schloss Laufen and then follow the signboard and walk to the Rhine Falls. On your return to the city, start your city tour from the Bahnhofstrasse - Zurich’s main street. On your way, you will see Zurich's landmarks - The Fraumunster Church, Zurich Lake (Limmat) and the Grossmunster. As an alternative to Rhine falls or city tour you can take a trip to the FIFA museum. All of this is included in theSwiss Pass cost!

mainEntity.name: What are the top things to do in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The top things to do in Zurich are:
  1. Altstadt (The Old Town)
  2. Swiss National Museum
  3. Zurich Zoo
  4. Uetliberg
  5. A Cruise on the Limmat
  6. Walk the Bahnofstrasse
  7. FIFA Museum
  8. Dolderbahn
  9. Zurich's Munsters
  10. Zurich Street Parade
  11. Rhine Falls

mainEntity.name: What is the best time to visit Zurich if you want to watch a parade?

acceptedAnswer.text: Every year, the Zurich parade is a crowd puller that takes place on the second Saturday in August. May reckon the lively Zurich parade as the world's largest electronic parties on the street! The parade draws almost million people who all find some party or the other in the street.

mainEntity.name: What is the Dolderbahn in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Dolderbahn in Zurich is single cabin rack railway that takes you up to the Dolder recreation area and the amazing Hotel Dolder Grand. It’s 6 minutes ride and once on top, gives a lovely view over the surroundings. There are hiking trails, a wave pool and mini golf courses at the top. It is also a winter attraction when it offers ice-skating and ice hockey.

mainEntity.name: What can I cover with the Swiss Rail Pass in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: Apart from the local transportation in Zurich, the local attractions can be covered with the Swiss Rail Pass. You can start from the Bahnhofstrasse - Zurich’s main street. On your way, you will see Zurich's landmarks - The Fraumunster Church, Zurich Lake (Limmat) and the Grossmunster. These places can be reached with the help of tram too, which is included in the Swiss Rail Pass. Rhine Falls is included and is easily accessible by train. You can take the train to Neuhausen or Schloss Laufen and then follow the signboard and walk to the Rhine Falls. The FIFA Museum and Swiss National Museum is also included as the Swiss Rail Pass also gives free access to many museums.

mainEntity.name: Is the entry to the FIFA musuem included in the Switzerland Train Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: The FIFA Museum has quickly become one of the must-do attractions of Zurich. The entry to FIFA Museum, Zurich is free with Switzerland Train Pass.

mainEntity.name: Is it possible to do any boat cruise in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, boat cruises are possible to include in your Switzerland Itinerary. Walk to the pier in front of the Swiss National Museum and get into one of the boats that depart every half an hour. You get amazing views of Zurich's Old Town which spans both banks of the river. The cruise will pass by historic guild houses, the Town Hall and the imposing facades of the Grossmunster and the Fraumuster.

mainEntity.name: Is it a good option to visit Uetliberg in Zurich?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Uetliberg is an unmissable attraction that every elated traveller makes it a part of their Switzerland travel package. Often called Zurich's own little mountain, Uetliberg panoramic point is a must-do thing to do in Zurich on any given day. Standing 2850 feet above sea level, Uetliberg offers you stunning views of the surrounding lakes, Alps and the city and it is still very easily accessible from the city by train or tram. You can also decide to walk to the peak and back.

Blog.headline: Best 10 Things to do in Interlaken [Updated 2021]
Blog.description: Interlaken, which literally means between two lakes, is nestled between Lake Thun and Lake Brienz and is an essential part of every Swiss itinerary. The many things to do in Interlaken offers an amazing number of attractions due to its proximity to the lakes, and the formidable Alps that surround it.

A minimum of 2 nights to a maximum of 7 nights in Interlaken is recommended for your Switzerland trip. acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, from Interlaken on both lakes Thun and Brienz have boats departing regularly that take you on a leisurely journey of the surrounding areas.

acceptedAnswer.text:
There are lots of local sights that can be covered as a part of city tour in Interlaken. These are:
  1. Ballenberg Museum – An open air musuem offering insight into Swiss culture, traditions and rural ways of life.
  2. St. Beatus Caves and its cascading waterfalls.
  3. Hoheweg - The main street of Interlaken
  4. Hohematte – A green park in town spread over 14 hectares.

mainEntity.name: What is the most ideal way of spending a day in Interlaken?

acceptedAnswer.text: An ideal day in Interlaken would be combination of a mountain excursion and a local city tour. Start early in the morning and make your way to Jungfraujoch, spend around 2 – 3 hours on top and start descent after lunch. You can start moving towards the main street Hoheweg where you’ll find plenty of shopping stores, cafes and restaurants. You could even try your luck at the Casino Kursaal in the evening. Jungfrau is a full day excursion, so if you prefer something with a shorter duration, you can replace with with Grindelwald first or Harder Kulm (shortest in terms of duration) followed by a cruise or a jet boat ride.

mainEntity.name: Is it worth including Interlaken in your Swiss trip?

Blog.headline: 10 Things to do in Switzerland in Summer + Bonus Tip!

mainEntity.name: Which month during summer is best if you’re planning Switzerland trip?

  • a trip by Boat on Lake Lucerne up to Alpnachstad

Blog.headline: 11 Things to do in Zermatt, Switzerland
Blog.description: A trip to Switzerland can never be complete without visiting the foothills of Matterhorn and experiencing all the things to do in Zermatt. Zermatt is a typical Swiss town. Its winding streets filled with all kinds of small and big historical chalets, all levels of hotels and innumerable cafes, restaurants, sportswear and souvenir shops are buzzing with activity all year round. The car free resort is one of the most visited places in the country and destination for all kinds of winter sports, and of course skiing.

mainEntity.name: How many nights are recommended in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: There are quite a lot of things to do in Zermatt like Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, Gornergrat, Sunnegga etc., so about 2 – 3 night's stay is recommended in Zermatt.

mainEntity.name: Does the Swiss Rail Pass cover excursions in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the Swiss Rail Pass covers various activities and excursions in Zermatt. Excursions like Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, Gornergrat, Sunnegga offer Swiss Rail Pass holder rates which means the travelers get a discounted rate on these excursions.

mainEntity.name: Are there any adventure activities that one can be done in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, adventure activities like paragliding, hiking, helicopter flights, biking, cycling and of course skiing are all possible in Zermatt

mainEntity.name: What are the famous hiking trails in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: The most famous hike in Zermatt is called ‘Five Lake Walk tour’. The path leads you past the 5 mountain lakes of Stellisee, Grindjisee, Grünsee, Moosjisee and Leisee. Grab the perfect pictures of the reflection of the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise as you will see it in the Stellisee, Grindjisee and Leisee. This is not a difficult hike and can also be done by kids of over 6 years.

mainEntity.name: What is the duration of the Five Lake Walk tour in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Five Lake Walk tour in Zermatt may take around 2.5 hours to complete but that would depend on your speed and the stops that you make along the way.

mainEntity.name: What activities can kids do in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Kids and adults can indulge in the same activities more or less. Mountain excursions like Matterhorn Glacier Paradise and Sunnegga are free for children below 16 years holding a family card. Sunnegga has a Wolli Adventure Park where you can have a dip in the lake and the kids can cross it on secured rafts. There are plenty of nice picnic and barbeque spots as well. Forest Fun Park is home to the longest kid's adventure course in Switzerland, this a fun filled activity place for the full family.
If you take the Five Lake Walk Tour, you will find picnic spots along the way and a children's playground at the Leisee.

mainEntity.name: What is the Forest Park in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Forest Fun Park is home to the longest kid's adventure course in Switzerland. The Park allows you to test your skills on the high ropes and zip lines. There are various courses that start from the Green Course for beginners and first-time visitors all the way to the Black Course for experienced rope course adventurers. This is a fun-filled activity place for the full family.

mainEntity.name: Can Europabrucke or Charles Kuonen Suspension Bridge be covered from Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: Though technically not in Zermatt, Charles Kuonen Suspension Bridge is a part of a hike that you can do from here. You will have to make your way Randa to start the hike and reach the world's longest hanging suspension bridge: The Europabrücke / Charles Kuonen Suspension Bridge.

mainEntity.name: Is Zermatt a car free town? How do people move around Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Yes, Zermatt is a car free town.
Electrical cars, busses, horse drawn carriages are used as a mode of transportation, but most parts of the town can be covered on foot. Try taking a tour of village starting from the main station – it would take you around one hour to half a day depending on what you want to cover.

mainEntity.name: What is the Gorner Gorge and how long does it take to reach there from Zermatt station?

acceptedAnswer.text: Gorner Gorge is one of the activities you can cover while you’re in Zermatt. Different Rock formations formed over thousands of years due to fast running waters of the Gornervispe created this stunning natural spectacle. Reaching the gorge would take a roughly 20-to-30-minute walk from the main station.

mainEntity.name: What is the duration of a Helicopter ride in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: A Helicopter ride in Zermatt is usually available for duration of 20, 30 or 40 minutes. All subject to weather conditions. This is one of the most expensive activities in Zermatt, but nothing can compare to an aerial view of the beautiful Swiss Alps.

mainEntity.name: Why is Matterhorn Glacier Paradise so famous?

acceptedAnswer.text: The first thing one wants to do in Zermatt is get the best views of the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. It is said to be the inspiration behind the triangular shape of the famous Swiss Toblerone chocolate. Head to the highest cable car station - Matterhorn Glacier Paradise in Europe (3883 metres) for just that.

mainEntity.name: What is the cost of Matterhorn Glacier Paradise in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you are travelling with the Swiss Travel Pass, you get a discount on the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise excursion. The full fare rate is CHF 104, and the Swiss Pass holder fare is CHF 52 per person. Children below 16 years with a family card travel for free!

mainEntity.name: Where do you get the best views of the Matterhorn from?

acceptedAnswer.text: You get the best views of Matterhorn from Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, Gornergrat and Sunnegga. The Matterhorn is also visible from the time you step into Zermatt village.

mainEntity.name: Is Gornergrat worth doing in Zermatt?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Gornergrat is worth doing in Zermatt. Europe's first electric and highest open air cog railway will take you on an unforgettable 40-minute journey to the top station at 3100 metres passing over bridges, forests, tunnels and stunning views. On a clear day you get a view of twenty-nine 4000 metre peaks including the Matterhorn, Breithorn, Monte Rosa and if lucky, even Mont Blanc.

mainEntity.name: What are the various things you can do in Zermatt, Switzerland?

Top Things to do at Zermatt, Switzerland:

mainEntity.name: What should a day in Zermatt be like?

acceptedAnswer.text: There’s lots to cover in Zermatt. Your typical day in Zermatt should be like visit most famous mountain excursion like Matterhorn Glacier Paradise or Gornergrat. After your descent from the mountain, a walk around the car free resort town of Zermatt, covering the Church Square, Matterhorn Museum making your way to the station. You will come across small and big chalets, different hotels, innumerable cafes, restaurants, sportswear and souvenir shops.

mainEntity.name: Is Zermatt worth including in your Switzerland itinerary?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it is definitelty worth covering Zermatt when travelling to Switzerland. Zermatt is a typical Swiss town. Its winding streets filled with chalets, hotels, cafes, restaurants and souvenir shops. The car free resort is one of the most visited places in the country. A Switzerland itinerary can never be complete without visiting the foothills of Matterhorn.

mainEntity.name: Where can you use the Eurail Global Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Eurail Global Pass can be used on the national rail networks of 33 European countries. These include Austria, Belgium, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, England, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Macedonia, Montenegro, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Scotland, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey and Wales.

mainEntity.name: Is the Eurail Global Pass worth purchasing?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, for someone who is planning to cover majority of the European countries within a month’s time or more, the Eurail Global Train Pass is totally worth purchasing.

mainEntity.name: What are the various classes available on the Eurail Global Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Eurail Global Pass has both 1st and 2nd class options, and unlike other Eurail Passes for one country, this Eurail Pass has a consecutive option too, along with flexi.

mainEntity.name: Which Eurail Pass can you buy if you are travelling to multiple countries?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you are travelling multiple countries, you can opt for a Euro Rail Global Pass which covers 33 European countries.

mainEntity.name: Is it cheaper to use the Eurail Global Pass or purchase individual European rail tickets?

acceptedAnswer.text: In most cases the Eurail Global Pass turns out to be cheaper than purchasing individual European rail tickets. This depends on the number of sectors you will be travelling to. If you have just one or two sectors in Global, shorter duration, there’s a chance that sectors tickets would turn out to be cheaper, however, if you have more than 2 sectors and the Pass would turn out to be an economic option. We suggest you check out the Eurail ticket prices and Eurail Global pass before you make a booking.

mainEntity.name: How many times can the Eurail Global Pass be used?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Eurail Global Pass can be used on the rail networks of 33 European countries for unlimited train journeys for the chosen validity within a month (4, 5, 7, 10 or 15 days within 1 month) for a flexi pass. For continuous pass holder, it can be used for unlimited travel for 15 days, 22 days, 1, 2 or 3 months. This is one of the best Eurail pass benefits you are entitled to, as compared to purchasing European train tickets separately which only allows you to travel on a fixed route, at a specific date and time.

mainEntity.name: What days of validity is available for the Eurail Global Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Eurail Global Pass is valid for 4, 5, 7, 10 or 15 days within 1 month if you opt for a Flexi pass. Unlike other Eurail Pass options, this pass has a consecutive / continuous type option too. The Euro Rail Global Pass is valid for 15 days, 22 days, 1, 2 or 3 months if you opt for a consecutive option. You can start using your pass for the chosen validity period as soon you activate them.

mainEntity.name: Do children travel free on the Eurail Global Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, children below the age of 12 years travel for free if travelling with a parent / adult holding a Eurail Global Pass. Reservations for children are not included and must be paid for while making a booking. European train tickets may come with a full fare rate including reservation, but they do not offer free travel for children below 12 years.

mainEntity.name: How many children can travel on the Eurail Global Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: On the Europe Rail Pass, up to 2 children can travel with 1 adult. If there are more than 2 children travelling with one adult, the third child would have to purchase a separate Eurail pass.

mainEntity.name: Do kids below 12 years travel free when accompanied by another youth or senior member instead of parents on the Eurail Global Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, on the Eurail Global Pass, a child travelling with someone who has a Eurail Pass Senior or a Youth Pass is not eligible to travel for free. They must purchase a separate Eurail pass for the child. The child’s ticket must be purchased with an Adult category pass only.

acceptedAnswer.text: Under the Euro Rail Global Pass option, the age limit for passengers to qualify as youth passengers is upto 28 years. A person aged between 12-27 years can purchase a youth pass.

mainEntity.name: Does the Eurail Global Pass have a consecutive pass option?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the Europe Train Pass does come with a consecutive pass option along with a Flexi pass option.

acceptedAnswer.text: On the Eurail Global Pass, or on any Eurail pass, passengers above 60 years of age qualify as senior category.

mainEntity.name: Are reservations included with the Eurail Global Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, the Eurail Global Pass does not include seat reservations. They have to be paid for separately just like you would have to for other open train tickets in Europe. Full fare European train tickets on the other hand may include reservation but would be available at a higher price. Its suggested to check and compare before purchasing.

mainEntity.name: Does the Eurail Global Pass come as a paper ticket or an e-ticket?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Eurail Global Pass comes as an electronic pass that can be loaded on your cell phone with the Rail Planner App. While on tour, you would also need an internet connection once every three days in order to add / view / validate your pass. The Eurail Mobile pass feature is also available for other countries as ‘Eurail One Country pass’ as well as Eurail Global Pass.

mainEntity.name: How soon should you activate your Eurail Global Pass?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can activate your Europe Train Pass once you are sure of your dates. If you are not sure activate it any time before your departure. Please make sure this you activate before you start your journey or else the pass remains invalid for travel. Unlike other European rail tickets, Eurail Pass does not come with a date unless it is validated.

acceptedAnswer.text: The Rail Europe Pass is valid for upto 11 months/ from the date of purchase. You must activate your pass within these 11 months. Till the Eurail pass is not activated, it is not ready for use.
